comments: A000005(a(n)) = A005408(n+1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 04 2007The compositions of n in which each natural number is colored by one of p different colors are called p-colored compositions of n. For n>=1, a(n) equals the number of 25-colored compositions of n such that no adjacent parts have the same color. - Milan Janjic, Nov 17 2011
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (25).
formula: G.f.: 1/(1-25*x). - _Philippe DelÃ©ham_, Nov 23 2008E.g.f.: exp(25*x) - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 29 2009a(n)=25^n; a(n)=25*a(n-1) n>0 a(0)=1 [From Vincenzo Librandi, Nov 21 2010]
